queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{subscriber-app}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{user-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{read-app}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{user-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{write-app}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{user-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{frontend-app}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{user-container}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{write-app}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{user-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{frontend-app}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{user-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{subscriber-app}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{user-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{read-app}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{user-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{read-app}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{subscriber-app}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{write-app}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{frontend-app}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: Namespaces like 'default', 'kube-system' or 'kube-public' should not be used

files.expected_value: metadata.namespace should be defined and not null
metadata.namespace should be defined and not null
metadata.namespace should be defined and not null
metadata.namespace should be defined and not null

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{subscriber-app}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{user-container}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{subscriber-app}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{user-container}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{read-app}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{user-container}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{read-app}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{user-container}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{frontend-app}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{user-container}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{frontend-app}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{user-container}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{write-app}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{user-container}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{write-app}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{user-container}}
